column1:
toon10001,"2012-08-01T09:05:48.593Z","A true leader","

Stormer gets the xl treartment now,
column2: a big dude who deserves the title leader.

column1: Bone wise nothing new, exepct a new double female, no ball end joint in short size. Very useful piece. Armor we get 4 body pieces, 1 silver 3 white, 6 size 5 armor, 4 are white 2 are blue, 4 size 3 whites, and a huge chestplate
column3: that requires the balljoints where the arms go to attatch. we get a large torso in black and a regular torso in gry for the first time. We also get a piece that looks like a liftarm with 3 pins but a balljoint in the middle so it can attach armor, bones and such. 6 friction joints from the ultrabuilds/black Phantom, and some new feet, which look lie robo-bird feet. 2 swords with silver&nbsp
column4: and blue, and 5 drone pieces that are meant to represent little robots that come off and attack. Some standard fare hero items (laucher, cuffs, hero core) and soem axels and stuff. Sticker sheet included.

column1: The legs use all the strenght joints to make him taller and strong, he won't fall over. The chestplate goes over the shoulder joints and stays quite nicely. a second torso from the back will make a design for the arms (same as the one from the ultrabuild hulk) then the sword and gun go on the arms.
He is pretty cool, hate the stickers but he works nicely. one thing i would change is on the lower legs i would change the size 5 to a body armor, as it looks awkward like this.
He is very nice looking, attacks well and overall an epic dude. One flaw with the arms is they stick out awkwardly but push them forward from the torso to fix it.
Coming next, I dont know, bit it will be either Voltix, Core hunter or Stringer. Stay tuned.

herofactoryguy23,"2012-09-09T07:35:28.253Z","A legendary leader","The most loved Alpha Team leader is back after 1 year. It is a great set. which I must highly recommend if you're a HF fan.


The build

The build is a bit easy, but can be challenging because of the stickers. First. the build started with torso build. then adding the whole legs. then the back torso is added. and addition of 3 scout drones with armour and weapons, then addition of the Stormer head. and finally the Hulk chestplate and the last 2 scout drones,
column2:
Playability

This has over 15 points of articulatun. The ball feature sounds great, but the sword is way too thin,
column3:
Pros:

-Better than the Hulk Ultrabuild

-New foot pieces

-New pieces

-Ball weapon

-Stormer in 2012

Cons:

-Expensive as 179.95 kr

-89 pieces

-Head still fragile

-The weapon is way too short

-Stickers

Conclusion:

Overall it is a great set. It is much better than the Hulk Ultrabuild,







",TRUE,4,5,4,4,3

column1: Toa_Daiker,"2012-12-27T12:45:08.177Z","Another Hulk","The set is basically the Hulk from the Marvel sets, only much more flawed. LEGO has been trying hard to rescue the big builds from the monotonous and unappealing ""Fire Lord"" builds, but this took it &nbsp
column2: a bit too far. The body is for the most part the best part of the set, thought the support beams under his shoulders aren't the best. Again, he's the Hulk. The arms are suprisingly short and really didn't look like much thought was put into them other than ""He needs arms."". The legs are the worst part. Overall they are just too skinny for such a model and really don't satisfy in appearance. The lower legs are really wierdly constructed. The feet though are pretty neat though. Overall, he's great for parts, but if you want a quality titan, look elsewhere.",FALSE,3,5,4,4,3

column1: Bigger than many Bionicle Titans, especially if you compare it to Axxion and is almost taller than Tuma
Durable, playable, but has an easily breakable Glatorian head

column2: s a great set if you want to build something big with very few pieces

column1:
,TRUE,4,4,4,5,4 jonathanfrye1999","2015-03-02T19:21:10.75Z","Stormer XL","

Welcome to a Jonathan and Jojo'

column2: posing in a icy wasteland with large ice spikes/columns in the background. The instructions were simple, clear and easy to follow.

column1: Mostly reused Ccbs parts, but Stormer also has new feet,
column2: a large breastplate and 5 little drone planes. The ball-joint extension pieces are also very useful for MOCing. We also like the new blaster piece and the swords.

column1: Stormer sat on them in the box.
Very simple. The lack of technic pieces utilized in the build was very disappointing, especially for a 25 buck "
Stormer is a tall and imposing figure. He towers above the Toa and Glatorian of old, and his large chestplate
column2: makes the Witch Doctor look scrawny.

column1: Stormer is in general a good set, but the 25 buck price tag and the low piece count keep him out of the "
column3: category. Love- Size, armor pieces, gun, sword pieces. Don&#39
column4: t love- cost, low piece count, stubby arms, not much Technic.
